original_summary: #Person1# asks #Person2# a cheap way to get to the airport. #Person2# guides #Person1# to take the subway and then transfer to the airport express's train.

transformed_conversations.personal_summary:
Here's a summary of your interactions with John over the past few months regarding his help getting you to the airport:

It all started back in early April when you first asked John for directions to the airport. He helpfully showed you the route on his phone and suggested taking the subway to save money. Throughout the spring, you kept in touch, with John checking in to see if you had any other questions before your trip. In May, you realized you weren't sure about luggage on the subway, so John provided more detailed guidance. As summer approached and your travel date got closer, you had a longer conversation where John shared some of his own travel experiences and tips for navigating the airport. He even offered to meet you at the subway station on your departure day to help with your luggage and make sure you caught the right train. That was a few weeks ago now. With your trip coming up in just a couple days, you messaged John yesterday to confirm the plan, and he assured you he'll be there to help. You're feeling much more confident about the whole journey thanks to John's ongoing support and friendship over the past several months.

messages.content: You: Excuse me where is the airport?
John: Um, it's pretty far away. I can show you on the map on my smart phone.
You: Oh, sorry, and what I meant is how can I get there?
John: Well, that depends. Do you want to get there quickly or cheaply?
You: Probably the latter would be better.
John: All right. If you go down one block and take a left, you'll see the number 12 subway station. Take the number 12 all the way to Grove Street. And then transferred to the airport express' train.
You: How will I know where to change trains?
John: There will be announcements on the train. But I'm sure there will also be a lot of other people with big suitcases. You can just follow them.
You: Got it, thanks so much for your help! I really appreciate it.
John: No problem at all, happy to help! Let me know if you have any other questions.
John: Hey, just wanted to check in and see if you had any other questions about getting to the airport? I'm happy to clarify anything!
You: Thanks for checking in! I think I'm all set for now. My trip isn't for a couple months still but I'll definitely let you know if anything else comes up.
John: Sounds good, I'm always happy to help! Wishing you smooth travels whenever your trip comes up.
You: Quick question - will I be able to bring my big suitcase on the subway or is that going to be a problem?

John: Great question. You can definitely bring luggage on the subway, there are no restrictions there. Just try to avoid peak commute times if possible so it's less crowded. And make sure you give yourself plenty of time in case elevators are out of service and you need to carry your bag up stairs.
You: Ok perfect, thanks for the tips! Glad I won't have to worry about the luggage.
John: For sure, you'll see lots of people with suitcases on the train to the airport. Feel free to reach out if you think of anything else!
You: Hey John, I realized I never asked - have you flown out of this airport yourself? Any insider tips?

John: Oh yeah, loads of times! I actually just got back from a trip last month. A few things I'd recommend - get there earlier than you think you need to, the security lines can be brutal. Bring an empty water bottle to fill up after security, since hydration is key for flying. And don't be afraid to ask for help from airport staff, they're usually quite friendly and helpful!
You: This is awesome advice, thanks! I'll make sure to leave extra early. Is two hours enough?

John: Two hours should be sufficient, unless it's a crazy busy travel day. If you're really worried you could bump it to 2.5 or 3 hours before departure. Better to have some extra time than to be rushing and stressed.
You: That's a good call. I'd much rather read a book at the gate than sprint to my plane!
John: Totally! And let me know when your travel date gets closer. If you want, I'd be happy to meet you at the subway station and help carry your bags over to the airport train.
You: Wow, that's so nice of you to offer! I may take you up on that. I'll keep you posted as it gets closer. Thanks again for all your help and advice!
John: It's my pleasure, really. I'm excited for you and your upcoming trip! Keep me in the loop and I'll make sure you're all set getting to the airport.
You: Hey John, just wanted to confirm - are you still able to meet me at the subway station tomorrow to help with my luggage? No worries at all if something has come up, I know it's last minute!
John: Absolutely, I'll be there! Just remind me again what time your flight is and when you're planning to head to the airport?
You: My flight is at 3:30pm, so I'm thinking I should be at the subway station around 12:30 to have plenty of time. Does that work for you?

John: That works great, I'll meet you at the entrance to the number 12 line at 12:30 tomorrow. We'll get you and your luggage on the train and make sure you're all set for the airport express transfer.
You: I can't thank you enough, John. You've made this whole process so much smoother and less stressful. I really appreciate you taking the time to help me out!
John: It's been my pleasure, honestly. I'm happy I can help make your travel day a little easier. Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow!
You: Likewise! See you at 12:30.
